title: Brainstem cholinergic-deficient mouse model dataset
description: Male mice and their wild-type controls were evaluated at 11-13 months of age to assess discrimination learning and cognitive flexibility using Pairwise visual discrimination (PVD) task and to assess learning and memory deficits using Pairwise Associate Learning (PAL) task.  Male mice and their wild-type controls were evaluated at 7-10 months of age to assess using 5-Choice Serial Reaction Time (5-CSRT) task for attention deficits.

type.value: This dataset was published in June 2019 in the Journal of Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology

affiliations.name: Robarts Research Institute, The University of Western Ontario

primaryPublications.title: Selective decrease of cholinergic signaling from pedunculopontine and laterodorsal tegmental nuclei has little impact on cognition but markedly increases susceptibility to stress
primaryPublications.publicationVenue: the Journal of the Federation American Societies for Experimental Biology (FASEB)
